context: 24 Gastric urease activity is a surrogate marker for the presence of H. pylori. Detection of this activity forms the basis of the rapid urease tests (CLO test, Pylori Tek test, Hp Fast) and radiolabeled carbon (13C, 14C) urea breath tests. The urea-gel test is a qualitative analysis of the urease activity in a small sample of gastric mucosa, i.e., a test of focal gastric urease activity. On the other hand, the [13C]urea breath test quantitatively measures the urease activity in a larger portion of the stomach and is considered a global test. In our study, the sensitivity, specificity, and positive and negative predictive values for the urea-membrane test at 1 hour were 98.0%, 93.9%, and 94.2% and 97.9%, respectively. These results are similar to the test characteristics of the urea-membrane test as reported by another research group. 25 Our preliminary work with the original PyloriTek test kit demonstrated it to be an accurate method for H. pylori detection.
